name: Introduction to A*
caption: www.redblobgames.com
description: In games we often want to find paths from one location to another. A* is a commonly recommended algorithm. Breadth First Search, Dijkstra’s Algorithm, and A* are graph search algorithms that use the same basic structure. They represent the map as a graph and then find a path in that graph. If you ha…

data.message:
Thank you very much for this link! :)
I've know about depth-first search (very easy) and deduced how breadth-first search would work, I studied Dijkstra a few times but in a confusing way (we studied it for routing in networks), and I always felt like A* is that really crazy thing that would be impossible to understand.
... and now I understood all of them in a few minutes =)
AI field is not so complex, but the way some people teach it makes it hard

yeah, professors make it sound hard, a friend of mine once wrote a post explaining pruning (for board game AIs) in a simple way, it was the first time for me to notice that these stuff aren't as hard as they seem :)
